Post-Match Reflections: Michael O’Neill picked out the positives after his Northern Ireland side were unable to capitalize on a string of chances in a goalless Nations League draw against Belarus in Zalaegerszeg, Hungary.
Others: This was a point gained even if it might have been all three. This was arguably to most awkward of Northern Ireland’s away fixtures in this Nations League campaign, not so much in terms of the opposition – Belarus are, despite recent improvement, the lowest ranked team in the group – but because of the neutral venue and the game being behind closed doors.
